intro: Cylicodaphne thwaitesii var. ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf cyclosorus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves and distinctive inflorescence. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in a spadix, typical of the Araceae family. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense colonies in wetland or marshy environments. It is often used in ornamental horticulture for its attractive foliage and adaptability to moist conditions.
